      • getZool

        public Zool getZool()

      • readChannel

        public ZoolReader readChannel(java.lang.String path,
                              boolean watch,
                              java.util.function.BiConsumer<java.lang.String,byte[]> dataHandler,
                              java.lang.Object ctx)
        Read a Zool Channel, using the drain method
        Parameters:
        path - the channel path to read.
        watch - true to continue to receive drain updates
        dataHandler - a data drain handler
        ctx - the context
        Returns:
        this ZoolReader

      • isReading

        public boolean isReading(java.lang.String channel)
        True if zool reader is reading a specific channel. Each reader can read multiple channels, each channel can have multiple ZoolDataSink attached.
        Parameters:
        channel - a channel (zk node)
        Returns:
        true if we are reading the channel.

      • readChannel

        public ZoolDataSink readChannel(java.lang.String channel,
                                java.util.function.BiConsumer<java.lang.String,byte[]> dataHandler,
                                java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.String> noDataHandler)
        Read a zool channel Creates a new ZoolDataSink against a specific channel.
        Parameters:
        channel - the path to the node
        dataHandler - the handler when data is received
        noDataHandler - the handler when no data was
        Returns:
        this ZoolReader

      • readChannelAndChildren

        public ZoolDataSink readChannelAndChildren(java.lang.String channel,
                                           java.util.function.BiConsumer<java.lang.String,byte[]> dataHandler,
                                           java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.String> noDataHandler,
                                           java.util.function.BiConsumer<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> childrenHandler,
                                           java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.String> noChildrenHandler)
        Read the channel and child nodes for a parent node.
        Parameters:
        channel - the channel (node path)
        dataHandler - the handler for data existence
        noDataHandler - the handler for no data existence
        childrenHandler - the handler for children
        noChildrenHandler - the handler for no children
        Returns:
        a ZoolDataSink that will have the child and channel data drained to it.

      • readChildren

        public ZoolDataSink readChildren(java.lang.String channel,
                                 java.util.function.BiConsumer<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> childrenHandler,
                                 java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.String> noChildrenHandler)
        Read Children only (don't care about the data in a node)
        Parameters:
        channel - the channel to read
        childrenHandler - the handler for children
        noChildrenHandler - the no children handler
        Returns:
        a new data sink.

      • getChannels

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<ZoolDataSink>> getChannels()
        Returns the set of channels we are currently listening on
        Returns:
        a List of ZoolDataSink

      • nodeExists

        public boolean nodeExists(java.lang.String path)
        True if the node at path already exists
        Parameters:
        path - the path
        Returns:
        a boolean

      • getChildNodes

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getChildNodes(java.lang.String nodePath,
                                                      boolean watch)
        Get the children of a node
        Parameters:
        nodePath - the patch
        watch - true if you want zookeeper to continue to update any data sinks (channels) on that path. if no Data sink is connected, this has no logical effect, but may incur connection resource cost.
        Returns:
        list of child names.
